meanings.definition: Not brought up or educated; lacking manners or refinement.
meanings.sent1: The wild child was so unbred that he didn't know how to use a fork.
meanings.sent2: The unbred puppy jumped on the table, showing its lack of manners.
meanings.sent3: The unbred parrot squawked loudly during the fancy dinner party.
meanings.sent4: Her unbred behavior at the opera was like a bull in a china shop.
meanings.sent5: The unbred teenager's loud burp echoed through the quiet library.

meanings.sent1: The unbred mare had never given birth to a foal.
meanings.sent2: The unbred chickens were not laying any eggs.
meanings.sent3: The unbred garden remained empty of new plants.
meanings.sent4: The unbred queen bee focused on building her hive instead of reproducing.
meanings.sent5: The unbred fish swam alone in the pond, without any offspring.
